title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: We were tete-a-tete, and several bumpers hadbeen quaffed by the Justice's special desire, when,on a sudden, he requested me to fill a bona fidebrimmer to the health of poor dear Die Vernon, therose of the wilderness, the heath-bell of Cheviot,and the blossom that's transplanted to an infernalconvent.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: We a' heard o' the public moneythat was ta'en frae the chield Morris Somewhereabout the fit o' Cheviot by Rob and ane o' the Osbaldistone lads ; and, to tell you the truth, wordgaed that it was yoursell, Mr Francis, and sorry wasI that your father's son suld hae ta'en to sic practice—Na, ye needna say a word about it—I seeweel I was mista'en; but I wad believe ony thingo' a stage-player, whilk I concluded ye to be.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Andrew, obdurate in the Laigh Kirk of Glasgow, ason the mountains of Cheviot, for some time deignedme no answer; and it was only when he found 1could not otherwise be kept quiet that he condescended to inform me, that, being once in the church,we could not leave it till service was over, becausethe doors were locked so soon as the prayers began.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: " Ah!" said the Justice, starting up with an alacrity which showed that he was not so engrossed byhis devotions to Themis, or Comus, as to forgetwhat was due to beauty—" Ah, ha! Die Vernon, theheath-bell of Cheviot, and the blossom of the Border, come to see how the old bachelor keeps house—Art welcome, girl, as flowers in May."
